queries: SELECT * FROM employees LIMIT 5
SELECT name, salary FROM employees WHERE salary > 3000
SELECT department, AVG(salary) AS avg_salary FROM employees GROUP BY department
SELECT * FROM employees ORDER BY salary DESC LIMIT 3
SELECT name, city FROM employees WHERE city = 'Baku'
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM employees
SELECT department, COUNT(*) FROM employees GROUP BY department
SELECT * FROM employees WHERE hire_date >= '2022-01-01'
SELECT name FROM employees WHERE email LIKE '%@company.com'
SELECT DISTINCT city FROM employees
INSERT INTO employees (name, age, salary, department, city) VALUES ('Yeni İşçi', 25, 2000, 'IT', 'Baku')
INSERT INTO products (name, price, category, stock) VALUES ('Yeni Məhsul', 99.99, 'Electronics', 50)
INSERT INTO departments (name, location, budget) VALUES ('Marketing', 'Baku', 150000)
INSERT INTO customers (first_name, last_name, email) VALUES ('Elvin', 'Qasımov', 'elvin@mail.com')
INSERT INTO orders (customer_id, total_amount, status) VALUES (1, 250.00, 'pending')
INSERT INTO employees (name, age, salary, department, city) VALUES ('Aysun Əliyeva', 29, 2800, 'HR', 'Gəncə')
UPDATE employees SET salary = salary * 1.1 WHERE department = 'IT'
UPDATE products SET price = price * 0.9 WHERE category = 'Electronics'
UPDATE employees SET city = 'Baku' WHERE city IS NULL
UPDATE customers SET loyalty_points = loyalty_points + 10 WHERE total_spent > 500
UPDATE orders SET status = 'completed' WHERE order_date < '2024-01-01'
UPDATE departments SET budget = budget + 50000 WHERE name = 'IT'
DELETE FROM employees WHERE age > 60
DELETE FROM products WHERE stock = 0
DELETE FROM orders WHERE status = 'cancelled'
DELETE FROM customers WHERE total_spent = 0
DELETE FROM employees WHERE department = 'Test'
DELETE FROM departments WHERE budget < 10000
CREATE TABLE test_table (id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY, name TEXT NOT NULL, value REAL)
CREATE TABLE users (user_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, username VARCHAR(50) UNIQUE, password TEXT, created_date TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP)
CREATE TABLE logs (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, message TEXT, created_at TIMESTAMP)
CREATE TABLE payments (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, order_id INTEGER, amount NUMERIC, payment_date DATE)
CREATE TABLE roles (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, role_name VARCHAR(50))
ALTER TABLE employees ADD COLUMN address TEXT
ALTER TABLE products ADD COLUMN weight REAL
ALTER TABLE customers ADD COLUMN birth_date DATE
ALTER TABLE orders ADD COLUMN shipped_date DATE
ALTER TABLE employees ALTER COLUMN salary TYPE NUMERIC(10,2)
ALTER TABLE users ADD COLUMN is_active BOOLEAN DEFAULT true
SELECT e.name, d.name FROM employees e JOIN departments d ON e.department = d.name
SELECT c.first_name, o.total_amount FROM customers c JOIN orders o ON c.id = o.customer_id
SELECT o.id, p.name FROM orders o JOIN products p ON o.product_id = p.id
SELECT e.name, d.location FROM employees e LEFT JOIN departments d ON e.department = d.name
SELECT c.first_name, SUM(o.total_amount) FROM customers c JOIN orders o ON c.id = o.customer_id GROUP BY c.first_name
SELECT name FROM employees WHERE salary > (SELECT AVG(salary) FROM employees)
SELECT * FROM products WHERE price = (SELECT MAX(price) FROM products)
SELECT name FROM employees WHERE department IN (SELECT name FROM departments WHERE budget > 200000)
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE total_spent > (SELECT AVG(total_spent) FROM customers)
SELECT department FROM employees GROUP BY department HAVING COUNT(*) > (SELECT AVG(cnt) FROM (SELECT COUNT(*) cnt FROM employees GROUP BY department) t)
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM orders
SELECT SUM(total_amount) FROM orders
SELECT AVG(price) FROM products
SELECT MAX(salary) FROM employees
SELECT MIN(budget) FROM departments
